title: Sherlock: Towards Multi-scene Video Abnormal Event Extraction and Localization via a Global-local Spatial-sensitive LLM
author: Junxiao Ma (Soochow University), Jingjing Wang (Soochow University), Jiamin Luo (Soochow University), Peiying Yu (Soochow University), Guodong Zhou (Soochow University), ...
relevance_why: The paper introduces a novel approach for extracting structured information from video data, which could inspire similar methodologies for audio data analysis or enhance current audio captioning models.
background: The task involves extracting and localizing abnormal events in videos, including aspects like what the event is, when it occurs, and where it takes place.
contribution: This paper introduces Sherlock, a Global-local Spatial-sensitive Large Language Model (LLM) to solve the challenge of video anomaly detection with structured outputs, achieving significant improvements over existing models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on general anomaly detection without considering the detailed spatial or contextual information of events.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances video anomaly detection by employing a mixture of experts approach tailored for both local and global spatial information.

key_innovation: Utilizes a Global-local Spatial-enhanced Mixture of Experts module for effective modeling and balancing of spatial information in videos.
real_world_impact: This approach can improve real-time monitoring systems for security and emergency response, enabling quicker identification and processing of abnormal events.

new_terms.Mixture of Experts: **Mixture of Experts (MoE)** is a model architecture that uses multiple expert models to solve different aspects of a problem, dynamically selecting experts based on the input.
new_terms.Spatial Imbalance Regulator: **Spatial Imbalance Regulator (SIR)** is a mechanism designed to achieve a balanced representation of various spatial information elements, preventing overfitting to more frequently occurring types.
